_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Wayne Farms LLC-Danville is a poultry processing facility that stores and uses ammonia, which is regulated by EPA's Risk Management Program.

Wayne Farms LLC-Danville's chemical storage and handling facilities has real and potential dangers.  Wayne Farms LLC-Danville's chemical storage and handling facilities
1.  are properly designed
2.  have effective operation and maintenance procedures
3.  employ trained operators and technicians
4.  periodically conduct safety audits, and
5.  are constantly upgrading its processes to meet or exceed industry standards

Wayne Farms LLC-Danville also has taken a proactive approach towards coordinating emergency efforts with the Danville Fire Department.  The Danville County E.M.A. has a copy of our emergency response program and is well trained and prepared to respond to the potential spills and leaks that may occur at the Wayne Farms LLC-Danville facility.  The Danville Fire Department also conducts annual site visits to our facility and is prepared to respond to possible spills or leaks.

A facility which maintains high standards, such as Wayne Farms LLC-Danville, provides less public risk than a facility that does not provide safe operations.  Wayne Farms LLC-Danville complies with Federal OSHA rules and guidelines for safe handling, storage and operation of chemicals.  We also utilize outside experts to preiodically inspect our systems integrity, train system operators, and upgrade systems to improve safety.

Wayne Farms LLC-Danville used EPA's OCA Guidance for off-site consequence analysis.  There has been no reportable release at this facility during the past 5 years.

CONCLUSION
Wayne Farms LLC-Danville-Poultry Divison believes that the poultry industry should proactively inform the public of the potential dangers and the actions that Wayne FarmsLLC has taken to minimize these dangers.  Wayne Farms LLC-Danville has a long-great ongoing relationship with the community.  We encourage any and all citizens who have concerns or
questions to contact our facility.  We look forward to continuing our relationship in Yell County.
